meanings.definition: The state or quality of being far.
meanings.sent1: The farness of the mountain peak made it seem unreachable.
meanings.sent2: The farness of the stars in the sky is mesmerizing.
meanings.sent3: Despite the farness of the grocery store, I walked there to get some snacks.
meanings.sent4: The farness of her dreams seemed closer when she took the first step towards them.
meanings.sent5: The farness of the ocean from the desert was a stark contrast in the landscape.

meanings.sent1: The farness between our houses made it difficult to visit often.
meanings.sent2: The farness of the finish line motivated the runners to push harder.
meanings.sent3: The farness between the two trees was perfect for hanging a hammock.
meanings.sent4: The farness between the islands was bridged by a beautiful rainbow.
meanings.sent5: The farness between the planets in the solar system is vast and awe-inspiring.

meanings.sent1: The farness of the cabin in the woods added to its charm.
meanings.sent2: The farness of the castle on the hill made it a mysterious destination.
meanings.sent3: Despite the farness of the beach, we decided to take a road trip.
meanings.sent4: The farness of the ancient ruins hinted at a forgotten civilization.
meanings.sent5: The farness of the lighthouse on the cliff guided ships safely through the night.
